name: scimax-vscode
description: Scientific computing environment inspired by Emacs Scimax - journal, literate programming, org-mode enhancements

scimax.directory.description: Root directory for Scimax files. Subdirectories include journal/, templates/, and notes.org. Individual directory settings (scimax.journal.directory, scimax.templates.directory) override this when explicitly set.

scimax.journal.directory.description: Directory for journal files. If empty, uses {scimax.directory}/journal

scimax.journal.template.description: Template name for new journal entries

scimax.journal.dateFormat.description: Date format for journal file names

scimax.journal.autoTimestamp.description: Automatically add timestamps to log entries

scimax.journal.weekStartsOn.description: First day of the week in calendar view

scimax.email.markdownDescription: Your email address for Scimax. Used for API integrations that benefit from identification (e.g., [OpenAlex polite pool](https://docs.openalex.org/how-to-use-the-api/rate-limits-and-authentication#the-polite-pool) for faster rate limits). Example: `user@example.com`

scimax.clock.showInlineTime.description: Show total clocked time as inline decorations on headlines

scimax.mark.ringSize.description: Maximum number of marks to store in the mark ring

scimax.logLevel.description: Log level for Scimax output. 'debug' shows all messages, 'error' shows only errors. Errors are always logged regardless of this setting.

scimax.db.includeJournal.description: Include journal directory in database indexing

scimax.db.includeWorkspace.description: Include workspace folders in database indexing

scimax.db.includeProjects.description: Include all scimax projects in database indexing

scimax.db.include.description: Additional directories or files to index (supports ~ for home directory)

scimax.db.exclude.description: Patterns or paths to exclude from indexing (globs like **/archive/** and absolute paths)

scimax.db.autoIndex.description: Automatically index workspace files on activation. Disable for large workspaces to prevent memory issues.

scimax.db.autoCheckStale.description: Automatically check for externally modified files (git pull, Dropbox sync, etc.) when database is first accessed. Runs in background without blocking.

scimax.db.staleCheckDelayMs.description: Delay in milliseconds before starting the background stale file check. Allows VS Code to finish loading first.

scimax.db.maxReindexPerSync.description: Maximum number of modified files to reindex per background sync. Set to 0 for unlimited.

scimax.db.maxNewFilesPerSync.description: Maximum number of new files to index per background sync. Set to 0 for unlimited.

scimax.db.queryTimeoutMs.description: Timeout in milliseconds for database queries. Prevents hung operations.

scimax.db.maxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum retry attempts for transient database failures (e.g., locked database).

scimax.db.maxFileSizeMB.description: Maximum file size in MB to index. Larger files are skipped to prevent memory issues. Useful when working with external repositories.

scimax.db.embeddingProvider.description: Embedding provider for semantic search. 'local' (default) uses Transformers.js running entirely on your machine (~30MB model download, ~100MB memory). 'ollama' uses local Ollama server. 'openai' uses OpenAI API. Set to 'none' to disable semantic search.

scimax.db.localModel.description: Local embedding model (downloads on first use)

scimax.db.openaiApiKey.markdownDescription: **Deprecated**: OpenAI API key is now stored securely. Use 'Scimax: Configure Embeddings' command instead.
scimax.db.openaiApiKey.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated. API keys are now stored securely in your OS credential manager. Use the 'Scimax: Configure Embeddings' command to set your API key.

scimax.projectile.scanMaxDepth.description: Maximum directory depth when scanning for projects. 0 means unlimited (default). Set to a positive number to limit recursion depth.

scimax.literate.pythonPath.description: Path to Python executable for code execution

scimax.ref.pdfDirectory.description: Directory containing PDF files for references

scimax.ref.citationSyntax.markdownDescription:
Citation syntax for inserting new citations:
- **org-ref-v3** (recommended): `cite:&key1;&key2` with pre/post notes
- **org-ref-v2** (legacy): `cite:key1,key2` comma-separated
- **org-cite**: `[cite:@key1;@key2]` org-mode 9.5+ native syntax

scimax.bibtex.keyPattern.markdownDescription:
Pattern for generating BibTeX citation keys. Available placeholders:
- `{lastname}` - First author's last name (lowercase)
- `{Lastname}` - First author's last name (capitalized)
- `{year}` - Publication year
- `{title}` - First significant word from title
- `{title:N}` - First N significant words (hyphenated, e.g., `{title:2}`)
- `{journal}` - Journal abbreviation or name
- `{keywords}` - First keyword
- `{type}` - Entry type (article, book, etc.)

Examples:
- `{lastname}-{year}-{title}`  `kitchin-2015-examples`
- `{Lastname}{year}`  `Kitchin2015`
- `{lastname}-{title:2}-{year}`  `kitchin-machine-learning-2015`

scimax.export.latex.documentClass.description: Default LaTeX document class (e.g., article, report, book). Can be overridden by #+LATEX_CLASS: in the document.

scimax.export.latex.classOptions.description: Default LaTeX class options as comma-separated values (e.g., '12pt,letterpaper'). Can be overridden by #+LATEX_CLASS_OPTIONS: in the document.

scimax.export.pdf.compiler.markdownDescription:
LaTeX compiler to use for PDF generation:
- `latexmk-lualatex` (recommended): Uses latexmk with lualatex, handles bibliography automatically
- `latexmk-pdflatex`: Uses latexmk with pdflatex
- `latexmk-xelatex`: Uses latexmk with xelatex
- `lualatex`: Direct lualatex (manual bibliography handling)
- `pdflatex`: Direct pdflatex (manual bibliography handling)
- `xelatex`: Direct xelatex (manual bibliography handling)

scimax.export.pdf.bibtexCommand.description: Bibliography processor to use (only applies when not using latexmk)

scimax.export.pdf.extraArgs.description: Extra arguments to pass to the LaTeX compiler (e.g., '-shell-escape')

scimax.export.pdf.openLogOnError.description: Automatically open the log file when PDF compilation fails

scimax.export.pdf.cleanAuxFiles.description: Clean up auxiliary files (.aux, .bbl, .blg, etc.) after successful compilation

scimax.export.pdf.shellEscape.markdownDescription:
Shell escape mode for LaTeX compilation:
- `restricted` (recommended): Allows minted/pygments syntax highlighting while blocking arbitrary shell commands
- `full`: Allows all shell commands via `\write18{}` (**security risk** - only use with trusted documents)
- `disabled`: No shell escape (minted will not work)

scimax.export.editmarkMode.markdownDescription:
How to handle editmarks during export:
- `show`: Render with visual markup (insertions, deletions, comments)
- `accept`: Apply all changes (keep insertions, remove deletions)
- `reject`: Revert all changes (remove insertions, keep deletions)
- `hide`: Remove all editmarks without any replacement

scimax.latexPreview.enabled.description: Enable LaTeX equation preview on hover

scimax.latexPreview.cacheEnabled.description: Cache rendered equations for faster hover responses

scimax.latexPreview.darkModeAware.description: Automatically adjust equation rendering for dark/light themes

scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnSave.description: Automatically rebuild PDF when the org file is saved

scimax.latexLivePreview.buildOnIdle.description: Automatically rebuild PDF after idle period

scimax.latexLivePreview.idleDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds before idle build triggers

scimax.latexLivePreview.useLatexmk.description: Use latexmk for smart incremental builds (recommended)

scimax.latex.compiler.description: LaTeX compiler to use. latexmk (default) automatically runs multiple passes to resolve references.

scimax.latex.pdfViewer.markdownDescription:
PDF viewer for SyncTeX support:
- `auto`: Detect based on platform (Skim on macOS, Zathura on Linux, SumatraPDF on Windows)
- `skim`: Skim (macOS)
- `zathura`: Zathura (Linux)
- `sumatra`: SumatraPDF (Windows)
- `vscode`: VS Code's built-in viewer

scimax.latex.enableChktex.description: Enable ChkTeX linting for LaTeX documents (provides warnings in Problems panel)

scimax.latex.latexmkEngine.description: Engine to use when compiling with latexmk

scimax.latex.validateReferences.description: Validate label references (warn about undefined/unused labels)

scimax.latex.formatOnSave.description: Automatically format LaTeX documents on save using latexindent

scimax.latex.autoCompileOnSave.description: Automatically compile LaTeX and refresh PDF when saving (only when PDF panel is open)

scimax.latex.showSyncDebugPopup.description: Show debug popup with SyncTeX coordinates when syncing between LaTeX source and PDF

scimax.notebook.directory.description: Default parent directory for new notebooks

scimax.hydra.showKeyHints.description: Show keyboard shortcuts inline with menu items

scimax.hydra.singleKeySelection.description: Select menu items with a single keypress (no Enter needed)

scimax.hydra.dimNonMatching.description: Dim menu items that don't match the current filter

scimax.hydra.sortByKey.description: Sort menu items by their keyboard shortcut

scimax.speedCommands.enabled.description: Enable org-mode speed commands (single-key shortcuts at beginning of headings)

scimax.agenda.includeJournal.description: Include journal directory in agenda scanning (uses scimax.journal.directory)

scimax.agenda.includeWorkspace.description: Include workspace folders in agenda scanning

scimax.agenda.includeProjects.description: Include all scimax projects in agenda scanning

scimax.agenda.include.description: Additional directories or files to include in agenda (supports ~ for home directory)

scimax.agenda.exclude.description: Patterns or paths to exclude from agenda (globs like **/archive/** and absolute paths like ~/file.org)

scimax.agenda.defaultSpan.description: Default number of days to show in agenda view

scimax.agenda.requireTodoState.description: Only show scheduled/deadline items that have a TODO state. When false, plain headings with timestamps will also appear.

scimax.agenda.todoStates.description: Active TODO states to show in TODO list

scimax.agenda.maxFiles.description: Maximum number of files to scan for agenda items (0 = unlimited)

scimax.agenda.batchSize.description: Number of files to process per batch during agenda scanning. Lower values reduce memory pressure but increase scan time.

scimax.agenda.batchDelayMs.description: Delay in milliseconds between processing batches. Allows the event loop to remain responsive during large scans.

scimax.imageOverlays.enabled.description: Enable inline image thumbnails in org-mode files

scimax.imageOverlays.maxWidth.description: Maximum width in pixels for thumbnail icons

scimax.imageOverlays.maxHeight.description: Maximum height in pixels for thumbnail icons

scimax.imageOverlays.renderMode.description: Where to display image thumbnails: hover-only (just hover preview, no icons), gutter (line margin), after (inline emoji), or both

scimax.imageOverlays.onlyWhenCursorNotIn.description: Hide overlay when cursor is inside the image link

scimax.imageOverlays.excludePatterns.description: Regex patterns for image paths to exclude from overlays

scimax.imageOverlays.maxOverlaysPerDocum.description: Maximum number of image overlays to display per document

scimax.imageOverlays.showDimensions.description: Show image dimensions in the after-content decoration

scimax.imageOverlays.cacheEnabled.description: Cache generated thumbnails for faster loading

scimax.capture.templates.markdownDescription: Capture templates for quick note-taking. Each template has: `key` (single char), `name`, `type` (entry/item/table-line), `file`, `headline` (optional), `datetree` (boolean), and `template` (with placeholders like `%^{prompt}`, `%t`, `%i`)

scimax.capture.defaultFile.description: Default file for captures when no target file is specified. If empty, uses {scimax.directory}/notes.org

scimax.capture.autoSave.description: Automatically save the file after capture

scimax.org.lint.disabledCheckers.description: List of org-lint checker IDs to disable. Available checkers: duplicate-custom-id, duplicate-name, missing-language-in-src-block, invalid-block, incomplete-drawer, broken-link, undefined-footnote-reference, unreferenced-footnote-definition, timestamp-syntax, clock-issues, orphaned-affiliated-keywords, wrong-header-argument, planning-inactive, heading-level-skip

scimax.templates.directory.description: Directory for user document templates. If empty, uses {scimax.directory}/templates

scimax.templates.dateFormat.description: Date format for {{date}} variable in templates (date-fns format)

scimax.templates.timeFormat.description: Time format for {{time}} variable in templates (date-fns format)

scimax.templates.author.description: Author name for {{author}} variable in templates. If empty, uses system user name

scimax.manuscript.autoCompile.description: When to run LaTeX compilation before flattening manuscript

scripts.compile: npm run build-doc-index && tsc -p ./ && npm run copy-assets
